reviews.text: The SW Hotel (named after Sam Wong) is in a terrific location, right between Chinatown and North Beach. If you are going for a weekend, be sure to get the 333 deal -- $333 for 2 nights, including tax, parking and a Go San Francisco pass good for admission to various museums and such. A very good deal in The City, especially given the location.
reviews.title: Great location but that is about it

reviews.text: Our first night was very quiet because we had a room that looked out on the interior air shaft. As others have said, the rooms are small, the walls are thin and the mattesses very firm. We could hear the enthusiastic couple next door the second night (but just for a little while, as it turned out.)
reviews.title: Great Bargain. Very nice for the money.

reviews.text: The interior rooms may be quieter than those fronting on the streets, since Broadway and Grant are both very busy and the hotel is only four stories high.
reviews.title: Nice location, not comfy

reviews.text: The continental breakfast was really not much...bread, half-bagels and palmiers. We headed to the Ferry Building where there is a fabulous farmer's market on Saturday and Sunday with incredible things to eat.
reviews.title: Excellent value and location!
Excellent Value and Location
reviews.text: It is an easy walk to either North Beach or Chinatown (and don't miss the City Lights bookstore a block away). We ate at Citizen Thai at the corner of Grant and Vallejo (just a few blocks away) the first night. A terrific spot and wonderful food. The second night we ate at El Raigon, a great Argentine restaurant on Union Street in North Beach (again, just a few blocks away.)

We just returned from a trip to the west coast and after staying in multiple hotels throughout CA it is a pleasure to recommend this hotel. I just read a review posted from last fall where they stated that the rooms were small,etc. Yes, much like hotels in Paris, this hotel room was small but more than adequate for our family of four that includes two teenagers. The hotel is very clean, quiet and the staff is very helpful. The breakfast is classic continental---pastries, coffee,tea & juice which was fine for our family. We highly recommend this hotel for your next stay in the beautiful city of San Francisco.
reviews.title: Clean,quiet and a wonderful location

reviews.text: The internet advertisements really made the place seem very classy, but the reality is not classy at all.
reviews.title: Disappointed!

reviews.text: Our overall impression was one of cutting corners - cheapness, from the beds to the skimpy "breakfast buffet." The coffee very weak. We just abandoned their offering and went out to eat. But that is not all.
reviews.title: Two Good Nights at the SW

reviews.text: The rooms are so small you can barely turn around. You literally have to rotate in place to turn around. We got a two-bed suite for two adults and two children, and you could only see the TV from one of the beds. The beds are crammed in to the room so tightly, that two of the four people must crawl in at an uncomfortable angle against the wall.
reviews.title: Nice place, great location

reviews.text: The extremely hard, short beds were made with all top sheets, no fitted sheets, and the bottom sheets were short, not tucked in, so the bed was always messy and uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Don't stay here!!!
Awesome Location, Clean, Comfortable, Spacious, Cheap Private Parking
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the SW Hotel(Which stands for Sam Wong the owner of the hotel) for an overnight excursion in San Franscisco on July 2nd. What we wanted in our hotel was that it was in a central location where we could walk to many of the main attactions, where nightlife and great restaurants where next door, that it was affordable, clean, comfortable, and had cheap unlimited in and out priviledge parking. Based on other user's reviews that we read, the SW seemed to fit the our specifications. The SW Hotel is definitely all of these! Located on the border of Chinatown and Little Italy: Fisherman's Warf, Coit Tower, Lombard Street, The Transamerica Building, and the Hyde and Powell Cable Car line are all within walking distance. The staff was friendly, our room was very clean, comfortable, and spacious. It also had free wireless internet access and unlimited daily in and out access to their own private garage which has a cheap fee of $20 a day compared to $30 in most places. Based on other's reviews the rooms on the street side of the hotel tend to be noisy because of the busy intersection this hotel is located at.(Broadway and Grant) The concierge automatically recommended the rooms towards the back of the hotel before I could even request for them. Even though our room's window had a view of another room window, our room was indeed quiet and we had a good night's rest after a full day of sight seeing. If you are looking for no-frills and a comfortable night's rest, the SW is for you. We are definitely staying at this hotel on our next San Franscisco trip.
Stayed at the SW hotel for three nights in March 2006. The hotel is well situated between the very authentic and busy Chinatown and the fine Italian restaurants of North beach.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The Hotel appeared to be deserted the entire time, I think we only saw one other guest. Looks like it has been recently remodeled to a good standard. Some nice Chinese style furniture and decor. Our room was a little small and had a horrible "view" but was clean and practical. My wife and I enjoyed the short walk down to Fisherman's Wharf and the surrounding areas. The eatery choices were quite excellent. Parking was interesting. The one way in lot underneath the hotel was a real problem getting into. The most bizaare parking lot I have ever seen.
reviews.title: A great getaway place.

reviews.text: Overall I give the hotel 3/5. You pretty much get what you pay for.
reviews.title: at chinatown/north beach, walk to union square and fisherman's wharf
complimentary breakfast buffet lacking
reviews.text: My wife and I stay at the SW on the recommendation of the wedding party we were attending. It was a bit difficult to find the first night since it was a busy Friday evening. Lots of 1 way streets and road closures that night that it took awhile to find a detour to the location. Also very easy to miss the parking entrance to the hotel. Room were average size but comfortable and clean. Hotel location is the biggest plus. Your are located in on the main strip of Chinatown. Walk down Grant to get the full experience. And in about 15-20 minutes, you'll hit Union Station. Lots a little places to eat too. Dim Sum is a must have. Stay away from the restaurant right across the street on the corner. Can't remember the name but it is a Chinese place across from the SW. Tourist trap. A bit pricey for Chinese food with very little portions. Stick with the small joints for great authentic, cheap eats. Oh ya... back to the SW. Staff is friendly and helpful. They printed out a Southwest boarding pass without making me pay for the pre-paid internet kiosk in the lobby (which by the way has NO printer). The cleaning staff was very, very nice. Remember to tip. They are very(x10) appreciative of it. Breakfast is toast, bagels, etc. Nothing fancy enough for a light breakfast. Like I suggest, try the Dim Sum (I recommend You's Dim Sum right next to the SW. Also, may have been a fluke but early Sunday morning at 6AM we had a false fire alarm and had to evacuate the building. Again, probably a fluke but what a wake up call. We would definitely stay there again with the wife.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very pleased to have found this gem in San Francisco. Not many hotels for this price have such great access to the city, great rooms (big bed and lovely bathroom), cheap parking, and friendly staff for such a good price. We didn't have much of an outlook but it was very quiet and felt safe. Located at the top of Chinatown, it's close to the variety of restaurants and bars of North Beach, and within walking distance of most of San Fran's sites. I've told lots of family and friends to stay here and we definitely will again!
reviews.title: Would definitely stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After our original hotel booking fell through a day before we were due
reviews.title: Would definitely stay again

reviews.text: to fly out to the states the race was on to find another decent hotel which we could afford. And SW was the place.
reviews.title: Would not stay again
Cheap, Good Location but NOISY!
reviews.text: Initially we went with it because at this late stage it was the only decent looking place with rooms for under £100 a night but on arrival we were very pleasantly surprised.

The check in was efficient, the room was great (clean, unique asian decor - what more do you want?!) and although the breakfast was quite basic, it's all we wanted to start the day considering the vast array of eateries in San Francisco (including Cafe Zoetrope whcih was a 2 minute walk away).
reviews.title: A Very Pleasant Stay!

likes.disliked: — The room size and the limited breakfast.
